entity.name: President Trump ends oil waivers to Iran
entity.description: President Trump ends oil waivers to Iran

entity.name: President Trump announces ‘hard hitting’ sanctions on Iran
entity.description: President Trump said he’s imposing sanctions on Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, and his office, “in response to Iran’s increasingly provocative actions.” The announcement comes after Iran shot down a US Navy drone last week.

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

entity.name: Hong Kong declares coronavirus outbreak an 'emergency'
entity.description: The city’s leader, Carrie Lam, also extended school holidays until February 17, suspended official visits to mainland China and said this year’s Hong Kong Marathon would not take place.

entity.name: Italy records first coronavirus death after a spike in cases
entity.description: According to Italian media, a person has died after at least 14 people in the region of Lombardy and two in the nearby region of Veneto were confirmed to be infected with the virus.

entity.name: Iran's deputy health minister tests positive for coronavirus a day after playing down outbreak fears
entity.description: During a televised press conference in Tehran on Monday, Iraj Harirchi was seen coughing and sweating while he assured the public that the coronavirus "situation is almost stable in the country." The Iranian deputy health minister, who is in charge of containing the spread of the pathogen, confirmed he tested positive for the virus the following day and is now under quarantine. The Islamic republic is currently amid a major outbreak with 15 dead, the largest outside of China.

entity.name: President Trump puts VP Pence in charge of US response to coronavirus
entity.description: Donald Trump said the risk to the US from the deadly coronavirus “remains very low” and that he has put Vice President Mike Pence in charge of the American response to the outbreak.
